refnamediv.refpurpose: create or examine a netscape certificate sequence

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: The nseq command takes a file containing a Netscape certificate sequence and prints out the certificates contained in it or takes a file of certificates and converts it into a Netscape certificate sequence.

listitem.para: This specifies the input filename to read or standard input if this option is not specified.
specifies the output filename or standard output by default.

normally a Netscape certificate sequence will be input and the output is the certificates contained in it. With the -toseq option the situation is reversed: a Netscape certificate sequence is created from a file of certificates.

refsection.title: EXAMPLES
refsection.para: Output the certificates in a Netscape certificate sequence

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: The PEM encoded form uses the same headers and footers as a certificate:

A Netscape certificate sequence is a Netscape specific form that can be sent to browsers as an alternative to the standard PKCS#7 format when several certificates are sent to the browser: for example during certificate enrollment. It is used by Netscape certificate server for example.

refsection.title: BUGS
refsection.para: This program needs a few more options: like allowing DER or PEM input and output files and allowing multiple certificate files to be used.
